newsitem.title: USA: Sudbury receives $170 million takeover bid.
newsitem.headline: Sudbury receives $170 million takeover bid.

text.p: Industrial supply company Sudbury Inc. said Tuesday it had received an unsolicited $170 million merger offer from Park-Ohio Industries Inc.
Sudbury said it was evaluating the offer and would continue to explore a number of avenues to boost shareholder value.
Park-Ohio said in a letter addressed to Sudbury that executives of both companies met on Aug. 22 to discuss Park-Ohio's offer.

Sudbury said Wall Street firm Alex. Brown & Sons Inc. had contacted a number of companies in July and August to examine their interest in acquiring Sudbury. The company said it expected preliminary indications of interest from other potential bidders on Sept. 6.
Cleveland-based Sudbury makes iron, aluminum and zinc castings; custom coatings; cranes, truck bodies, and related equipment; and precision machined components.
